metadata.title: CVE-2022-38177 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSAsignature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible togradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lackof resources.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-host - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-libs - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-utils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
bind9utils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
dnsutils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1').
